results.title: A Yearlong Cry for Help, Then Death After an Assault
results.abstract: Daniela Espirito Santo died after an assault by her boyfriend, who had been arrested, then released, by police. Her case is emblematic of Britain’s failure to protect victims of domestic abuse.

results.title: Europe Reopened to Americans. Why, It Asks, Hasn’t the U.S. Reciprocated?
results.abstract: America’s borders remain closed to most European travelers during the pandemic, even those fully vaccinated. With fears of the Delta variant raging, there appears to be no end in sight.

multimedia.caption: Peter Fuchs, 87, at his home in Hanover, Germany. On his way to the United States in May, he was told mid-journey that he could not board his flight to New York. The experience made him feel “helpless and broken down.”
multimedia.copyright: Gordon Welters for The New York Times
